doc:
Jacques Boudet https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Boudet 0 Jacques Boudet (born 29 December 1939) is a French stage and screen actor. He had great success in the 1980s with his appearance in Exercises in Style, and is featured in the film The Names of Love (2010). In cinema, he frequently appeared in films by Robert Guédiguian. He excels in composite roles such as his Duc de Guermantes in Un amour de Swann, the brother of the character played by Philippe Noiret in Père et fils and the cynical politician with a southern French accent in L'Ivresse du pouvoir. He also appeared in the 1979 British TV play Churchill and the Generals as Charles de Gaulle. Jacques_Boudet ( born_29_December_1939 ) is a_French_stage_and_screen_actor . He had great_success in the_1980s with his_appearance in Exercises in Style , and is_featured in the_film The_Names of Love_(_2010_) . In cinema , he frequently appeared in films by Robert_Guédiguian . He excels in composite_roles such_as his_Duc de Guermantes in Un_amour de Swann , the_brother of the_character played by Philippe_Noiret in Père_et_fils and the_cynical_politician with a_southern_French_accent in L'Ivresse_du_pouvoir . He also appeared in the_1979_British_TV_play_Churchill and the_Generals as Charles de Gaulle .
